perturbation.original_text:
10.4 Payment of Invoices
Each invoice provided by Supplier to Customer under Section 10.1, to the extent accurate, shall be paid by Customer to Supplier within [* * *] after
the date of the invoice to the extent that Customer does not reasonably dispute that portion of the invoice in good faith.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.4 Payment of Invoices
Each invoice provided by Supplier to Customer under Section 10.1, to the extent accurate, shall be paid by Customer to Supplier within [* * *] after
the date of the invoice to the extent that Customer does not reasonably dispute that portion of the invoice in good faith.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, Customer may elect to defer payment of up to 20% of any invoice for a period not to exceed [* * *] from the date of the invoice, subject to providing Supplier with written notice of such election within ten (10) days of receipt of the invoice.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by allowing the customer to defer a portion of the invoice payment, effectively extending the payment deadline under certain conditions. This conflicts with the original clause specifying a fixed payment term.

perturbation.original_text:
16.2 Maintenance of Records
Supplier shall maintain adequate books and records and retention samples consistent with cGMP Requirements and any other Applicable Law and
requirements of applicable governmental or regulatory authorities, in respect of test records, samples and associated support data for all batches of
Product Manufactured by Supplier sufficient to substantiate and verify Supplier’s duties and obligations under this Agreement for [* * *] from the
expiration date of the respective Product batch.
perturbation.changed_text:
16.2 Maintenance of Records
Supplier shall maintain adequate books and records and retention samples consistent with cGMP Requirements and any other Applicable Law and
requirements of applicable governmental or regulatory authorities, in respect of test records, samples and associated support data for all batches of
Product Manufactured by Supplier sufficient to substantiate and verify Supplier’s duties and obligations under this Agreement for [* * *] from the
expiration date of the respective Product batch. Customer, however, shall only be required to keep documentation for a period of [* * *].
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an inconsistency regarding the record retention periods for the Supplier and Customer. The original text specifies one timeframe for the supplier, while the addition sets a different, shorter duration for the customer, leading to uncertainty about which standard applies to shared documentation or data.

perturbation.original_text:
18.1 Termination
This Agreement is effective as of the Effective Date and will expire in accordance with Section 2.1, unless, upon the occurrence of any of the
following events, this Agreement is earlier terminated in accordance with this Section 18.1:
a) Customer delivers written notice of termination to Supplier at least [* * *] prior to the expiration date of the Initial Term, which termination shall
be effective as of the expiration date of the Initial Term;
perturbation.changed_text:
18.1 Termination
This Agreement is effective as of the Effective Date and will expire in accordance with Section 2.1, unless, upon the occurrence of any of the
following events, this Agreement is earlier terminated in accordance with this Section 18.1:
a) Customer delivers written notice of termination to Supplier at least [* * *] prior to the expiration date of the Initial Term, which termination shall
be effective as of the expiration date of the Initial Term; notwithstanding the foregoing, Customer may terminate this agreement with 30 days notice if Supplier has not met certain quality thresholds as defined by Exhibit E.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces conflicting terms regarding termination. Subsection (a) stipulates a specific timeframe for termination notification before the term's end. However, the addition allows for a shorter, conditional termination timeframe related to quality thresholds, contradicting the original longer notice period.
